item.content:encoded:
17) Using SELECT INTO with a multi million row table

18) Using cursors to update some data, bonus points for using dynamic cursors

19) Running sp_updatestats during work hours

20) Rebuilding all indexes without checking fragmentation levels, meanwhile you should have used SQLFool’s defrag script

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
A couple more

13) Truncating your log file (your favorite)

14) using BEGIN TRAN around a 2 hour long query and locking everything up for everyone else

15) Not checking for how much free space you have left and filling up the drive with the transaction log

16) Adding indexes in the hope that it will help speed up the query even though the queries are not sargable or the selectivity level of these indexes is just to low (like an index on middle initial, gender. salutation)
